CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 25, 1962, pg. 16, reads: "The Author Confers - Recent guests entertained in lovely home of the Rev. and Mrs. W. Augustus Jones, 920 Clarissa St., included Dr. Judith Brigham (seated, third from left), who is a resident of Louisville, Ky., and has written several books, including '100 Years of Southern Baptists' and 'American Dialects.' Other guests are, left to right, seated: Mrs. W. A. Jones Jr., Mrs. F. E. Clysdale of London, Ontario, Canada, mother of the author; the Rev. W. A. Jones, host, and Mrs. L. W. Bumpus. Standing: The Rev. and Mrs. R. L. Kincheloe (he is executive secretary of the Council of Churches, Pittsburgh area); Mrs. W. A. Jones, hostess; the Rev. and Mrs. B. J. Hopson (he is pastor of Mt. Olive Baptist Church, Rankin) and Dr. L. W. Bumpus, executive secretary of the Pittsburgh Baptist Association. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait, seated from left, Mrs. W. A. Jones Jr., Mrs. F. E. Clysdale, Dr. Judith Brigham, Rev. W. A. Jones, Mrs. L. W. Bumpus; standing: Mrs. Kincheloe, Rev. R. L. Kincheloe, Mrs. W. A. Jones, Mrs. Hopson, Rev. B. J. Hopson, and Dr. L. W. Bumpus, posed in home of W. Augustus Jones, 920 Clarissa Street
